description:
Creates a job on Dataflow, which is an implementation of Apache Beam running on Google Compute Engine. For more information see
the official documentation for
[Beam](https://beam.apache.org) and [Dataflow](https://cloud.google.com/dataflow/).

tfcfnid.description: Internal identifier for tracking resource changes. Do not use.

IpConfiguration.description: The configuration for VM IPs.  Options are `"WORKER_IP_PUBLIC"` or `"WORKER_IP_PRIVATE"`.

Labels.description:
User labels to be specified for the job. Keys and values should follow the restrictions
specified in the [labeling restrictions](https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/labeling-resources#restrictions) page.
**NOTE**: Google-provided Dataflow templates often provide default labels that begin with `goog-dataflow-provided`.
Unless explicitly set in config, these labels will be ignored to prevent diffs on re-apply.

MachineType.description: The machine type to use for the job.

MaxWorkers.description: The number of workers permitted to work on the job.  More workers may improve processing speed at additional cost.

Name.description: A unique name for the resource, required by Dataflow.

Network.description: The network to which VMs will be assigned. If it is not provided, "default" will be used.

OnDelete.description: One of "drain" or "cancel".  Specifies behavior of deletion during `terraform destroy`.  See above note.

Parameters.description: Key/Value pairs to be passed to the Dataflow job (as used in the template).

Project.description: The project in which the resource belongs. If it is not provided, the provider project is used.

ServiceAccountEmail.description: The Service Account email used to create the job.

Subnetwork.description: The subnetwork to which VMs will be assigned. Should be of the form "regions/REGION/subnetworks/SUBNETWORK".

TempGcsLocation.description: A writeable location on GCS for the Dataflow job to dump its temporary data.

TemplateGcsPath.description: The GCS path to the Dataflow job template.

Zone.description: The zone in which the created job should run. If it is not provided, the provider zone is used.
